intro: Calycolpus roraimensis, commonly known as the Roraima calycolpus, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palm-like appearance, with a tall, unbranched stem and large, palmate leaves. It produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters at the top of the stem. This species is often found in wet, swampy areas and is adapted to the humid, nutrient-poor conditions of the rainforest.
